instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Black Screen/Kernel Panic
threads.message:
Hello. 

This macbook came in like 1 year ago because of distorted image on the screen, in that time I resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and reballed the GPU. 

The computer worked fine for that period of time and now it is randomly crashing: black screen followed by a restart. It says "panic (CPU...") 

Ive red about the CPU fets issue on this board, but never experienced the issue. Do you think this can be the issue? 


Thanks a lot!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Black Screen/Kernel Panic
threads.message:
No idea where did you read such thing; this board doesn't use FDMF6808N chips.

Test disabling GPU...
